name: Salt and Pepper Tofu
description: Crispy and flavorful tofu seasoned with salt and pepper.
instructions: Cut the tofu into cubes and toss in cornflour until coated.
Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat.
Fry the tofu cubes in batches for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally until golden and crispy.
Remove tofu from the pan and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Season with salt and plenty of ground black pepper.
Garnish with sliced spring onions and serve hot.

name: Satay Sweet Potato Curry
description: A creamy and flavorful sweet potato curry with a hint of satay.
instructions: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the crushed garlic and curry powder, cook for another minute.
Add the cubed sweet potatoes, peanut butter, coconut milk, soy sauce, and brown sugar. Stir well to combine.
Bring to a simmer and cook for about 20 minutes or until the sweet potatoes are tender.
Stir in the lime juice and season with salt to taste.
Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.

name: Sesame Salmon with Purple Sprouting Broccoli and Sweet Potato Mash
description: A delicious and nutritious meal featuring sesame-coated salmon, purple sprouting broccoli, and sweet potato mash.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
Place the salmon fillets on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
Brush the salmon fillets with olive oil and sprinkle sesame seeds on top, pressing lightly to adhere.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and the sesame seeds are golden.
While the salmon is cooking, place the sweet potatoes in a large pan of boiling water and cook for 10-12 minutes, or until tender.
In another pan of boiling water, cook the purple sprouting broccoli for 3-4 minutes, or until tender.
Drain the sweet potatoes and return them to the pan. Mash with butter until smooth and season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve the sesame salmon with the sweet potato mash and purple sprouting broccoli.

name: Rosti Fish Cakes
description: Delicious fish cakes made with tender fish fillets and crispy rösti potatoes.
instructions: Place the grated potatoes in a clean tea towel and squeeze out excess moisture.
Heat half the butter and oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.
Add the grated potatoes to the pan and press down firmly with a spatula to form a large potato cake.
Cook for 10-12 minutes until golden and crispy on the bottom, then carefully flip and cook for another 8-10 minutes until the other side is golden and crispy.
Meanwhile, place the fish fillets in a pan of boiling water and simmer for 3-4 minutes until cooked through.
Drain the fish and flake into a large bowl. Add the spring onions, egg, parsley, lemon zest, salt, and black pepper. Mix well to combine.
Divide the fish mixture into four equal portions and shape into fish cakes.
Heat the remaining butter and oil in a clean frying pan over medium heat.
Add the fish cakes to the pan and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side until golden and cooked through.
Serve the fish cakes with the crispy rösti potatoes.

name: Green Eggs
description: A vibrant and nutritious dish made with spinach and eggs.
instructions: Wash the spinach thoroughly and roughly chop.
Heat the butter in a pan over medium heat.
Add the chopped spinach to the pan and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
Crack the eggs into the pan over the spinach.
Cook the eggs until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve hot.

name: Ham, Mushroom, and Spinach Frittata
description: A flavorful and hearty frittata loaded with ham, mushrooms, and spinach.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C/160°C fan/gas 4.
In a large bowl, whisk the eggs and season with salt and black pepper.
Heat the butter in an ovenproof frying pan over medium heat.
Add the ham and mushrooms to the pan and cook until mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the spinach to the pan and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Pour the whisked eggs over the ham, mushrooms, and spinach in the pan.
Cook on the stovetop for 3-4 minutes until the edges start to set.
Transfer the pan to the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes until the frittata is set and golden on top.
Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before slicing and serving.

name: Basil Scramble with Wilted Spinach and Seared Tomatoes
description: A delicious and nutritious breakfast featuring basil-infused scrambled eggs, wilted spinach, and seared tomatoes.
instructions: In a bowl, whisk the eggs and season with salt and black pepper.
Chop the fresh basil leaves and add them to the whisked eggs, mixing well.
Heat the butter in a frying pan over medium heat.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are scrambled and cooked to your liking.
While the eggs are cooking, heat a separate pan over medium-high heat.
Add the cherry tomatoes to the hot pan and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until they are slightly seared and softened.
In the same pan used for cooking the eggs, add the baby spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Serve the scrambled eggs with wilted spinach and seared tomatoes on the side.
Garnish with extra fresh basil leaves, if desired.

name: Runner Bean Tortilla with Tomato Salad
description: A tasty tortilla made with runner beans, served with a refreshing tomato salad.
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a large bowl, whisk the eggs and season with salt and black pepper.
Add the sliced runner beans, potatoes, and red onion to the bowl with the eggs, mixing well to combine.
Heat the olive oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook for 6-8 minutes until the bottom is set and golden.
Transfer the pan to the grill and cook for another 6-8 minutes until the top is set and golden.
Meanwhile, prepare the tomato salad by combining the cherry tomatoes, torn basil leaves, olive oil, and white wine vinegar in a bowl. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve the runner bean tortilla with the tomato salad on the side.
Enjoy!

name: Masala Frittata with Avocado Salsa
description: A flavorful frittata spiced with masala, served with a refreshing avocado salsa.
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.

In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, chopped red onion, halved cherry tomatoes, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric, chilli flakes, and chopped fresh coriander leaves. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Heat the olive oil in an ovenproof frying pan over medium heat.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook for 6-8 minutes until the bottom is set.
Transfer the pan to the grill and cook for another 6-8 minutes until the top is set and golden.
While the frittata is cooking, prepare the avocado salsa by combining the diced avocado and lime juice in a bowl. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve the masala frittata hot with the avocado salsa on the side.
Enjoy!

name: Griddled Chicken with Quinoa Greek Salad
description: A delicious and nutritious Greek salad with griddled chicken and quinoa.
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons of olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, and dried oregano. Season with salt and black pepper.
Place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them. Allow to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Cook the quinoa according to package instructions. Once cooked, fluff with a fork and set aside to cool.
Heat a griddle pan over medium-high heat. Remove the chicken breasts from the marinade and cook on the griddle pan for 5-6 minutes on each side, or until cooked through and charred.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, halved cherry tomatoes, diced cucumber, thinly sliced red onion, halved black olives, crumbled feta cheese, and chopped fresh parsley.
Drizzle the remaining tablespoon of olive oil over the salad and toss to combine. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve the griddled chicken with the quinoa Greek salad on the side.
Enjoy!

name: Lamb Chops with Hummus and Roasted Tomatoes
description: Deliciously seasoned lamb chops served with creamy hummus and roasted tomatoes.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
In a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, ground cumin, ground coriander, and paprika.
Rub the spice mixture over both sides of the lamb chops, then season with salt and black pepper.
Place the cherry tomatoes on a baking tray, drizzle with olive oil, and season with salt and black pepper. Roast in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
While the tomatoes are roasting, heat a grill pan over medium-high heat.
Grill the lamb chops for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your liking.
To serve, spread a generous spoonful of hummus onto each plate, top with the grilled lamb chops, and roasted tomatoes.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.
Enjoy!

name: Mediterranean Fish Gratins
description: A delightful Mediterranean-inspired fish dish baked to perfection with tomatoes, olives, and cheese.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
Place the white fish fillets in a baking dish. Season with salt and black pepper.
In a bowl, combine the halved cherry tomatoes, halved black olives, minced garlic, olive oil, lemon zest, and torn basil leaves. Season with salt and black pepper.
Spoon the tomato and olive mixture over the fish fillets.
Drizzle lemon juice over the top and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes until the fish is cooked through and the topping is golden and bubbling.
Serve hot, garnished with extra torn basil leaves if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Speedy Mediterranean Gnocchi
description: A quick and flavorful Mediterranean-inspired dish made with pillowy gnocchi, cherry tomatoes, spinach, and feta cheese.
instructions: Cook the gnocchi according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.
Add the halved cherry tomatoes to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes until softened.
Stir in the minced garlic and dried oregano, cooking for another minute until fragrant.
Add the cooked gnocchi and baby spinach to the pan. Toss everything together until the spinach is wilted and the gnocchi is heated through.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the top.
Serve hot and enjoy your speedy Mediterranean gnocchi!

name: Deli Couscous
description: A delightful couscous salad packed with Mediterranean flavors, perfect for a quick and tasty meal.
instructions: Place the couscous in a large heatproof bowl.
Heat the vegetable stock until boiling and then pour it over the couscous. Cover the bowl with a plate or lid and let it sit for 5 minutes until the couscous has absorbed all the liquid.
Fluff the couscous with a fork to separate the grains.
Add the halved cherry tomatoes, diced cucumber, finely chopped red onion, halved black olives, crumbled feta cheese, and chopped fresh parsley to the couscous.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon zest, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Drizzle the dressing over the couscous salad and toss everything together until well combined.
Serve the deli couscous at room temperature or chilled, as desired.
Enjoy!

name: Mediterranean Spelt Stuffed Peppers
description: Deliciously hearty and nutritious bell peppers stuffed with Mediterranean spelt, tomatoes, olives, and feta cheese.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. Place them in a baking dish.
Cook the pearl spelt according to package instructions. Drain any excess liquid and transfer to a large bowl.
Add the halved cherry tomatoes, halved kalamata olives, crumbled feta cheese, finely chopped red onion, and chopped fresh parsley to the bowl with the spelt.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the spelt mixture and toss everything together until well combined.
Stuff the bell peppers with the spelt mixture, pressing down gently to pack it in.
Cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for another 10-15 minutes until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
Serve the Mediterranean spelt stuffed peppers hot, garnished with extra chopped parsley if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Mediterranean Turkey Stuffed Peppers
description: Deliciously flavorful bell peppers stuffed with a Mediterranean-inspired turkey filling, perfect for a hearty and nutritious meal.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. Place them in a baking dish.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and chopped red onion and cook until softened.
Add the ground turkey to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon as it cooks.
Stir in the halved cherry tomatoes, halved kalamata olives, dried oregano, chopped fresh parsley, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Cook for another 2-3 minutes until everything is heated through.
Season the turkey mixture with salt and black pepper to taste.
Stuff the bell peppers with the turkey mixture, pressing down gently to pack it in.
Cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
Remove the foil and sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the top of each stuffed pepper.
Bake for another 10-15 minutes until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted and golden.
Serve the Mediterranean turkey stuffed peppers hot, garnished with extra chopped parsley if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Mediterranean Potato Salad
description: A refreshing and flavorful potato salad inspired by Mediterranean ingredients, perfect for any occasion.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the baby potatoes and cook until tender, about 15-20 minutes.
While the potatoes are cooking, prepare the dressing. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Drain the cooked potatoes and let them cool slightly. Once cool enough to handle, cut the potatoes into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked potato pieces, halved cherry tomatoes, halved kalamata olives, finely chopped red onion, and chopped fresh parsley.
Pour the dressing over the potato mixture and toss everything together until well coated.
Taste and adjust seasoning with additional salt and black pepper if needed.
Chill the potato salad in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.
Serve the Mediterranean potato salad chilled, garnished with extra chopped parsley if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Antipasti Salmon
description: Deliciously seasoned salmon fillets served with a medley of Mediterranean-inspired antipasti.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
Place the salmon fillets on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
In a bowl, combine the halved cherry tomatoes, black olives, capers, and drained artichoke hearts. Tear the fresh basil leaves and add them to the bowl.
Drizzle the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and lemon zest over the antipasti mixture. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Toss everything together until well combined.
Spread the antipasti mixture around the salmon fillets on the baking tray.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Remove from the oven and squeeze lemon juice over the salmon and antipasti.
Serve the antipasti salmon hot, garnished with extra fresh basil leaves if desired.
Enjoy!

name: All-in-One Fish Supper
description: A complete and satisfying fish dish with a variety of flavors, featuring baked cod fillets, potatoes, cherry tomatoes, and olives.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
Place the halved baby potatoes in a large roasting tin. Drizzle with olive oil, lemon zest, minced garlic, chopped fresh parsley, salt, and black pepper. Toss to coat.
Roast the potatoes in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
Remove the roasting tin from the oven and add the cherry tomatoes and pitted kalamata olives to the potatoes. Toss to combine.
Season the cod fillets with salt and black pepper. Arrange them on top of the potatoes, tomatoes, and olives.
Drizzle the cod fillets with a little more olive oil and lemon juice.
Return the roasting tin to the oven and bake for another 10-12 minutes until the cod is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve the all-in-one fish supper hot, garnished with additional chopped parsley if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Mediterranean Style Oysters
description: Exquisite oysters served Mediterranean-style, enhanced with a tantalizing combination of olive oil, lemon, garlic, and herbs.
instructions: Preheat the grill to high heat.
Scrub the oyster shells under cold running water to remove any dirt or debris.
Shuck the oysters and arrange them on a baking sheet lined with rock salt to keep them level.
In a small bowl, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, chopped fresh parsley, chopped fresh thyme, salt, and black pepper.
Drizzle the herb mixture over each shucked oyster.
Place the baking sheet under the grill and cook for 5-7 minutes until the oysters are heated through and the edges begin to curl.
Carefully remove the baking sheet from the grill and transfer the oysters to a serving platter.
Serve the Mediterranean-style oysters immediately, accompanied by crusty bread if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Crispy Fried Calamari with Aioli
description: Delightfully crispy calamari rings served with a creamy aioli dipping sauce, perfect as a starter or appetizer.
instructions: In a shallow bowl, combine the plain flour and cornflour. Season with salt and black pepper.
In another shallow bowl, whisk together the egg and milk.
Place the panko breadcrumbs in a third shallow bowl.
Dip each calamari ring first into the flour mixture, shaking off any excess, then into the egg mixture, and finally into the breadcrumbs, pressing gently to adhere.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking.
Fry the coated calamari rings in batches for 2-3 minutes until golden brown and crispy, turning occasionally.
Use a slotted spoon to transfer the fried calamari rings to a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.
Sprinkle the crispy fried calamari with chopped fresh parsley and serve immediately with aioli dipping sauce.
Enjoy!

name: Courgette Quinoa Stuffed Peppers
description: Healthy and flavorful bell peppers stuffed with a delicious mixture of quinoa, courgette, tomatoes, and herbs.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. Place them in a baking dish.
Cook the quinoa according to package instructions. Drain any excess liquid and transfer to a large bowl.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced courgette, cherry tomatoes, minced garlic, and finely chopped red onion. Cook for 5-7 minutes until softened.
Add the cooked vegetables to the bowl with the quinoa. Stir in the chopped fresh parsley, chopped fresh basil, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Stuff the bell peppers with the quinoa and vegetable mixture, pressing down gently to pack it in.
Cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for another 10-15 minutes until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
Serve the courgette quinoa stuffed peppers hot, garnished with extra chopped parsley if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Bacon Brie Omelette Wedges with Summer Salad
description: Delicious omelette wedges filled with crispy bacon and creamy brie, served with a refreshing summer salad.
instructions: In a bowl, beat the eggs with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add the chopped bacon and cook until crispy. Remove from the pan and set aside.
Pour the beaten eggs into the same pan. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the edges start to set.
Sprinkle the cooked bacon and diced brie evenly over one half of the omelette.
Fold the other half of the omelette over the filling to form a semi-circle. Cook for another 2-3 minutes until the eggs are set and the cheese is melted.
Slide the omelette onto a cutting board and cut into wedges.
In a large bowl, combine the mixed salad leaves, halved cherry tomatoes, and thinly sliced red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil and balsamic vinegar to make the dressing. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
Serve the bacon brie omelette wedges hot, accompanied by the summer salad.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves and enjoy!

name: Barcelona Baguette
description: A delicious baguette inspired by the flavors of Barcelona, featuring chorizo, manchego cheese, and roasted red peppers.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
Slice the baguette in half lengthwise and place it on a baking sheet.
Layer the sliced chorizo, manchego cheese, and roasted red peppers evenly over the bottom half of the baguette.
Place the baguette in the preheated oven and bake for 5-7 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil and balsamic vinegar to make the dressing. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Remove the baguette from the oven and top with rocket leaves. Drizzle the balsamic dressing over the rocket leaves.
Place the top half of the baguette over the rocket leaves to form a sandwich.
Slice the baguette into individual portions and serve hot.
Enjoy the Barcelona baguette!

name: Herbed Lamb Cutlets with Roasted Vegetables
description: Deliciously tender lamb cutlets coated in aromatic herbs, served with a medley of roasted vegetables.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
Place the baby potatoes, sliced carrots, red onion wedges, sliced zucchini, and cherry tomatoes on a large baking tray.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle minced garlic, chopped fresh rosemary, and chopped fresh thyme over the vegetables. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Toss to coat evenly.
Roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes until the vegetables are tender and golden brown, turning halfway through cooking.
While the vegetables are roasting, season the lamb cutlets with salt and black pepper. Rub both sides of each cutlet with chopped fresh rosemary and thyme.
Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned lamb cutlets and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or to your desired doneness.
Remove the roasted vegetables from the oven and transfer to serving plates. Top with the cooked lamb cutlets.
Serve the herbed lamb cutlets with roasted vegetables hot.
Enjoy!

name: Chorizo Pilaf
description: A flavorful and comforting rice dish with spicy chorizo, mixed vegetables, and fragrant herbs.
instructions: Heat a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat. Add the diced chorizo and cook for 2-3 minutes until it starts to release its oil.
Add the diced onion, minced garlic, diced red bell pepper, and diced yellow bell pepper to the skillet. Cook for another 5 minutes until the vegetables are softened.
Add the basmati rice to the skillet and stir to coat in the chorizo and vegetable mixture.
Pour in the chicken or vegetable broth and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook for 15-18 minutes until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
Stir in the frozen peas and chopped fresh parsley. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Cover and let the pilaf sit for 5 minutes before serving to allow the peas to heat through.
Serve the chorizo pilaf hot as a delicious and comforting meal.
Enjoy!

name: Broad Bean & Feta Cheese Toasts
description: A simple and flavorful toast recipe featuring creamy broad beans and tangy feta cheese on crispy bread slices.
instructions: Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add the shelled broad beans and cook for 2-3 minutes until tender. Drain and rinse under cold water to cool.
Remove the outer skins from the broad beans to reveal the bright green inner beans.

In a bowl, combine the shelled broad beans, crumbled feta cheese, minced garlic, chopped fresh mint leaves, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Mash lightly with a fork to combine.
Preheat the grill or broiler to high heat.
Brush both sides of the sourdough bread slices with olive oil. Place them on a baking sheet and grill for 2-3 minutes on each side until lightly toasted.
Spread the broad bean and feta cheese mixture evenly onto the toasted sourdough slices.
Return the toasts to the grill and cook for another 2-3 minutes until the topping is heated through and slightly bubbly.
Remove from the grill and serve the broad bean and feta cheese toasts hot.
Enjoy!

name: Baked Salmon with Fennel and Tomatoes
description: A delicious and healthy baked salmon dish with aromatic fennel and juicy tomatoes, seasoned with herbs and lemon.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
In a baking dish, arrange the thinly sliced fennel bulb and cherry tomatoes.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle minced garlic over the vegetables. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Toss to coat evenly.
Place the salmon fillets on top of the bed of fennel and tomatoes. Season the salmon with salt and black pepper.
Arrange lemon slices over the salmon fillets and sprinkle chopped fresh dill on top.
Cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Remove the foil during the last 5 minutes of cooking to allow the salmon to brown slightly.
Serve the baked salmon with fennel and tomatoes hot, garnished with additional fresh dill if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Salmon, Avocado, and Cucumber Salad
description: A refreshing and nutritious salad featuring flaky salmon, creamy avocado, and crunchy cucumber, drizzled with a tangy dressing.
instructions: Preheat the grill or broiler to high heat.
Season the salmon fillets with salt and black pepper. Grill for 4-5 minutes on each side until cooked through and flaky.
In a large bowl, combine the mixed salad leaves, thinly sliced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, and thinly sliced red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, honey, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Add the sliced avocado to the salad bowl.
Once the salmon is cooked, remove from the grill and let it cool slightly. Flake the salmon into bite-sized pieces and add to the salad.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss gently to coat evenly.
Divide the salmon, avocado, and cucumber salad between serving plates.
Serve immediately, and enjoy this refreshing and nutritious salad!
Enjoy!

name: One-Pan Summer Eggs
description: A simple and satisfying one-pan dish featuring eggs, summer vegetables, and flavorful herbs, perfect for a quick and nutritious meal.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
In a large ovenproof skillet or frying pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the diced zucchini, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, and red onion to the skillet. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are softened.
Add the halved cherry tomatoes to the skillet and cook for another 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
Create wells in the vegetable mixture and crack the eggs into the wells.
Season the eggs with salt and black pepper, and sprinkle chopped fresh basil over the entire dish.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 8-10 minutes until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
Remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving.
Divide the summer eggs between serving plates and enjoy this delicious one-pan meal!
Enjoy!

name: Baked Eggs with Spinach and Tomato
description: A delicious and nutritious dish featuring baked eggs nestled in a bed of flavorful spinach and tomato sauce, perfect for breakfast or brunch.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
In a large ovenproof skillet or frying pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the spinach to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes until wilted.
Stir in the halved cherry tomatoes, smoked paprika, ground cumin, and ground coriander. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Cook for another 2-3 minutes until the tomatoes start to soften.
Create wells in the spinach and tomato mixture and crack the eggs into the wells.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
Remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving.
Divide the baked eggs with spinach and tomato between serving plates and enjoy!
Enjoy!

name: Prawn and Broccoli Asian Omelette
description: A flavorful and satisfying omelette filled with juicy prawns, crunchy broccoli, and Asian-inspired seasonings.
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, grated ginger, and thinly sliced spring onion. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Heat the vegetable oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat.
Add the prawns to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes until they start to turn pink and opaque.
Add the broccoli florets to the pan and stir-fry for another 2 minutes until they are tender-crisp.
Pour the egg mixture over the prawns and broccoli in the pan. Allow it to cook undisturbed for 2-3 minutes until the edges start to set.
Using a spatula, gently lift the edges of the omelette and tilt the pan to let the uncooked egg mixture flow to the edges.
Once the omelette is mostly set but still slightly runny on top, carefully fold it in half using the spatula.
Cook for another 1-2 minutes until the omelette is cooked through and golden brown on the outside.
Slide the omelette onto a plate, slice, and serve hot.
Enjoy this delicious Prawn and Broccoli Asian Omelette!
Enjoy!

name: Sardines with Sicilian Fennel Salad
description: A refreshing and vibrant salad featuring tender sardines paired with crisp Sicilian fennel and a zesty lemon dressing.
instructions: Preheat the grill or broiler to high heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, lemon zest, Dijon mustard, honey, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
In a separate bowl, toss the thinly sliced fennel, orange zest, orange segments, and chopped fresh parsley with half of the dressing.
Place the cleaned and gutted sardines on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Drizzle with the remaining dressing and season with salt and black pepper.
Grill the sardines under the preheated grill or broiler for 3-4 minutes on each side until cooked through and lightly charred.
Arrange the grilled sardines on serving plates alongside the Sicilian fennel salad.
Serve the sardines with Sicilian fennel salad immediately, and enjoy the vibrant flavors!
Enjoy!

name: Butternut Squash and Sage Soup
description: A comforting and creamy soup featuring the rich flavors of roasted butternut squash and fragrant sage.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.
In a large baking tray, toss the diced butternut squash with olive oil, minced garlic, and fresh sage leaves. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Roast the butternut squash in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes until tender and caramelized, stirring halfway through cooking.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook for 5-6 minutes until softened and translucent.
Once the butternut squash is roasted, add it to the pot with the softened onions. Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a simmer.
Using an immersion blender or countertop blender, blend the soup until smooth and creamy.
Stir in the cream and season with additional salt and black pepper if needed.
Serve the butternut squash and sage soup hot, garnished with fresh sage leaves.
Enjoy the comforting flavors of this delicious soup!
Enjoy!

name: Thai Squash Soup
description: A fragrant and flavorful Thai-inspired soup featuring butternut squash, coconut milk, and aromatic spices.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook for 5-6 minutes until softened and translucent.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the pot, and cook for another 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in the red curry paste and cook for 1 minute to release its flavors.
Add the diced butternut squash to the pot, followed by the coconut milk, vegetable broth, lime juice, and brown sugar. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Bring the soup to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 20-25 minutes until the butternut squash is tender.
Once the butternut squash is cooked, use an immersion blender or countertop blender to puree the soup until smooth and creamy.
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
Serve the Thai squash soup hot, garnished with chopped fresh cilantro.
Enjoy the fragrant and flavorful taste of this Thai-inspired soup!
Enjoy!

name: Lamb Chops with Smoky Aubergine Salad
description: Tender lamb chops served with a smoky and flavorful aubergine salad, topped with a zesty dressing, creating a deliciously balanced meal.
instructions: Preheat the grill or barbecue to medium-high heat.
In a bowl, combine the sliced aubergine, cherry tomatoes, thinly sliced red onion, chopped fresh mint leaves, lemon zest, olive oil, ground cumin, salt, and black pepper. Toss well to coat.
Grill the marinated aubergine slices on the preheated grill or barbecue for 3-4 minutes on each side until tender and lightly charred. Remove from the grill and set aside.
Season the lamb chops with salt and black pepper on both sides.
Grill the lamb chops on the preheated grill or barbecue for 3-4 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or longer to your desired level of doneness.
Once the lamb chops are cooked to your liking, remove them from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
To serve, arrange the grilled lamb chops on serving plates alongside the smoky aubergine salad. Drizzle with fresh lemon juice and additional olive oil if desired.
Garnish with extra chopped mint leaves and lemon wedges, if desired.
Enjoy this delicious lamb chops with smoky aubergine salad!
Enjoy!

name: Easy Ratatouille with Poached Eggs
description: A simple and flavorful ratatouille served with perfectly poached eggs, creating a satisfying and nutritious meal.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the pan, and sauté for 2-3 minutes until softened and fragrant.
Add the diced aubergine, courgette, and red bell pepper to the pan. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Cook for 8-10 minutes until the vegetables are softened.
Stir in the diced tomatoes and chopped fresh thyme. Cook for another 5-7 minutes until the tomatoes break down and the mixture thickens.
Using a spoon, create small wells in the ratatouille mixture for the eggs.
Carefully crack an egg into each well. Cover the pan and let the eggs poach in the ratatouille mixture for 5-7 minutes until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
Once the eggs are cooked to your liking, remove the pan from heat. Sprinkle with fresh chopped basil.
Serve the ratatouille with poached eggs hot, garnished with extra basil if desired.
Enjoy this simple and delicious dish of ratatouille with poached eggs!
Enjoy!

name: Layered Roast Summer Vegetables
description: A delicious and colorful dish featuring layers of summer vegetables roasted to perfection, creating a flavorful and nutritious meal.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6.

In a large roasting pan or baking dish, layer the sliced courgettes, red bell peppers, yellow bell peppers, and red onion. Scatter the cherry tomatoes and whole peeled garlic cloves over the vegetables.

Drizzle the olive oil and balsamic vinegar over the layered vegetables. Season generously with salt and black pepper. Strip the leaves from the fresh thyme sprigs and sprinkle them over the vegetables.
Toss the vegetables gently to coat them evenly with the oil, vinegar, and seasoning.
Roast in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, stirring halfway through cooking, until the vegetables are tender and caramelized around the edges.
Once the vegetables are roasted to perfection, remove them from the oven and let them cool slightly.
To serve, transfer the roasted vegetables to a serving dish. Garnish with freshly chopped basil.
Enjoy these delicious layered roast summer vegetables as a flavorful side dish or light main course!
Enjoy!

name: Lamb Steaks with Artichoke Salad
description: Juicy lamb steaks served with a refreshing artichoke salad, tossed in a tangy dressing, creating a delightful and satisfying meal.
instructions: Preheat the grill or barbecue to medium-high heat.
Season the lamb steaks with salt and black pepper on both sides.
Grill the lamb steaks on the preheated grill or barbecue for 4-5 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or longer to your desired level of doneness.
Once the lamb steaks are cooked to your liking, remove them from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the halved artichoke hearts, halved cherry tomatoes, thinly sliced red onion, and chopped fresh parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon zest, lemon juice, olive oil, Dijon mustard, honey, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the artichoke salad and toss well to coat.
To serve, divide the artichoke salad between serving plates and top with the grilled lamb steaks.
Garnish with extra chopped parsley and lemon wedges, if desired.
Enjoy this delicious lamb steaks with artichoke salad!
Enjoy!

name: Tuna Steaks with Cucumber Relish
description: Deliciously seared tuna steaks served with a tangy and refreshing cucumber relish, creating a light and flavorful dish.
instructions: In a bowl, combine the diced cucumber, diced red onion, halved cherry tomatoes, and chopped fresh parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon zest, lemon juice, olive oil, red wine vinegar, honey, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the cucumber relish and toss well to coat. Set aside.
Season the tuna steaks with salt and black pepper on both sides.
Heat a non-stick frying pan or grill pan over high heat. Add a little olive oil to the pan.
Once the pan is hot, add the tuna steaks and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or longer to your desired level of doneness.
Once the tuna steaks are cooked to your liking, remove them from the pan and let them rest for a few minutes.
To serve, divide the cucumber relish between serving plates and top with the seared tuna steaks.
Garnish with extra chopped parsley and lemon wedges, if desired.
Enjoy this delicious dish of tuna steaks with cucumber relish!
Enjoy!

name: Seared Steak with Celery and Pepper Caponata
description: Juicy seared steak served with a flavorful celery and pepper caponata, creating a satisfying and delicious meal.
instructions: Season the steaks with salt and black pepper on both sides.
Heat olive oil in a large frying pan or skillet over high heat.
Once the pan is hot, add the steaks and sear for 2-3 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or longer to your desired level of doneness.
Once the steaks are cooked to your liking, remove them from the pan and let them rest for a few minutes.
In the same pan, add a little more olive oil if needed. Add the diced red onion, diced red bell pepper, and thinly sliced celery stalks. Cook for 4-5 minutes until softened.
Stir in the capers, chopped olives, tomato passata, red wine vinegar, honey, and chopped fresh basil. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Cook the caponata mixture for another 5-7 minutes until heated through and slightly thickened.
To serve, spoon the celery and pepper caponata onto serving plates and top with the seared steaks.
Garnish with extra chopped basil, if desired.
Enjoy this delicious dish of seared steak with celery and pepper caponata!
Enjoy!

name: Rosemary Chicken with Oven-Roasted Ratatouille
description: Tender rosemary-infused chicken served with a flavorful oven-roasted ratatouille, creating a delicious and wholesome meal.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C (180°C fan) or 390°F (360°F fan).
In a large baking dish, combine the diced aubergine, diced courgette, diced red bell pepper, diced red onion, halved cherry tomatoes, minced garlic, and chopped fresh rosemary.
Drizzle olive oil and balsamic vinegar over the vegetables. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Toss well to coat.
Arrange the chicken thighs on top of the vegetables in the baking dish. Season the chicken with salt, black pepper, and additional chopped rosemary, if desired.
Roast in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender and caramelized, stirring halfway through.
Once cooked, remove from the oven and let rest for a few minutes.
To serve, divide the oven-roasted ratatouille and chicken thighs between serving plates.
Garnish with extra chopped rosemary, if desired.
Enjoy this delicious dish of rosemary chicken with oven-roasted ratatouille!
Enjoy!
